gherkin-definition.title: What is Gherkin
gherkin-definition.text1:
Gherkin is a structured, human-readable language used in software development, particularly within the context of Behavior-Driven Development (BDD).
  • It is designed to express test scenarios and user stories in a way that's clear, concise, and understandable by both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Gherkin uses keywords like "Given," "When," "Then," "And," and "But" to describe the context, actions, and expected results of a scenario.
In essence, Gherkin bridges the gap between business requirements and technical implementation by providing a common language for expressing and documenting software behavior.
